name: Hilton Newark Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the Hilton for a Friday night before our Early Saturday monring flight. The Hilton was one of the only decent hotels around Newark offering a park and fly package for that night. The deal seemed very good-- it was 149.00 for the night, and include 5 days of Valet Parking. The Valet parking turned out to be convienent as well.
reviews.title: Nice airport hotel, with good park & fly rates.

likes.liked: — Room quality, and park and fly package with Valet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dropped the car off around 3pm on friday, and with Valet parking i was at the Check-in desk within a min of arrival. Check-in was easy, and they gave me a room on a high floor with a good view of the airport. Nothing in Newark is really a decent view at all, but this wasnt too bad. The room was standard for a Hilton. Nothing better or worse then most Hilton properties I have stayed at. It was clean, had nice bathoom, comfy bed, and standard amenties. I had plenty of time on my hands so I checked out their pool and fitness area. I never used the pool or hot hub, but they looked above average for a airport hotel. The fitness center I did use, and it's quite small, but no one was in it. All the machines are very new, and room was clean and well stocked. We had a bite to eat a couple of drinks at the lobby bar. Food was just ok in the bar, as they did not have much of a selection. But it's a nice atmosphere --with flat screen TV's and plenty of space for seating. There was a larger restaurant down the hall which is probably better for dinner.
reviews.title: Next Time Marriott

reviews.text: The shuttle left promptly in the Morning on our way to the airport, and only took about a couple of mins to get to the airport. On our way back it was there on arrival, and left in about 2-3 mins. I think we just lucky with that because they said it leaves about every 20 mins on average. Shuttle service was friendly and professional. On the way back the Valet took a little longer then desired, but all in all no problem with that either. One little issue is that leaving the hotel can be a problem for people not familiar with the area. Its a sketchy area and can be complcated to get back on to I-95. The road signs and routes are a disorganzied mess in the area.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

likes.liked: — After a long flight the room was clean/comfortable and got a good nights rest

reviews.text: Most likely a repeat for me. The park and fly package is great and so few hotels around Newark offer the rates. Last time we stayed at the Sheraton ( which is probably about equal to this place) but this time they were not offering park and fly.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay at the Hilton.

likes.liked: — Good service and proximity to New York City.

reviews.text: We spent one night at the Hilton Newark Airport this month needing a hotel close to airport. We secured our reservation through an online discount site at a decent rate for a Friday night.
reviews.title: I'd return to this hotel

reviews.text: I stayed here to connect with an early morning flight and because I was travelling with my dog and they allowed animals. They also have a free shuttle bus that is operating 24/7 (or was back then).
reviews.title: Very nice. Close to the airport.

likes.liked: — Price, proximity to the airport, airport shuttle bus.

reviews.title: Great place to stay after a long flight
reviews.text: It is a beautiful hotel. Staff were very friendly and efficient. However, the location is VERY dodgy. On the front side it is bordered by a highway, and on the other sides a graveyeard, parking lot and beyond that, a really sketchy area. I didn't really feel very safe walking my dog there and was followed around by a man. It was a good place to stay based on proximity to the airport, animal poilicy, shuttle and price. But, again, not a great area.

reviews.title: Nice place to stay when at Newark airport

likes.liked: — Price and location close to NYC
likes.disliked: — Had to pay $8 a night for parking! Booooo!

reviews.text: My family and I stayed at the Hilton Newark Airport 1 night before an early morning flight. We booked 2 rooms and arrived early (we were traveling through NY and had a flight cancel). The bellman was great; he welcomed us, organized our luggage, and worked with the front desk to find at least 1 available room we could use to put our luggage in. The restaurant was good for breakfast (typical of Hilton), and the front desk provided good recommendations of how to spend our free day and where to go for dinner at night. Overall, very friendly and helpful staff.
reviews.title: Good Airport Hotel

reviews.text: The rooms are of good size, well furnished and clean. Typical of Hilton. We only used the restaurant, but they seemed to have all the amenities you would expect of a good airport hotel. A previous reviewer had problems with the shuttle, but our experience was good. The shuttle runs every 20 minutes, 24 hours a day.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Hilton Newark Airport

description: With 24-hour shuttle service from and to Newark Liberty International Airport, this full service hotel offers comfortable guest rooms, a choice of food & beverage outlets as well as 24 hour room service. Our Precor Fitness Center and indoor heated pool are for hotel guests only. The hotel is conveniently located and a short train ride away to Newark and New York City, as well as Liberty State Park and NJ cruise piers.In 2012 the Hotel will complete a full room decor and furnishings renovation to include upgraded services.
